page.title: 12MEDIA- THE PENCOED DIARY
page.content: The Diary is a small, local newspaper containing news and advertisements. Someway or another he has to get information. He does this by attending council meetings or by people telephoning or writing letters to him. The editor said that 6,000 copies a month are produced and that it takes between 2 and 5 days to publish the Diary. The Diary has been in circulation for 2 years and is delivered free to each house. The paper is free because they receive about Â£500 from advertising. The editor said it was important that local events were included in the newspaper and he tried his best to see that his readers were kept well informed. A school survey showed that people enjoyed reading The Diary.
